description: Metal detecting and geophys in the area revealed large numbers of coins, personal objects, and a figurine of Mercury, along with a square enclosure with a SW facing entrance. All together this is suggested to be a shrine of some kind. Datable items suggest activity from the 1st to 4th CE.
bibliography: Brindle, Payne, and Hinds. “A New Romano-British Ritual Site at Great Bedwyn/Shalbourne, Wiltshire.” The Wiltshire Archaeological and Natural History Magazine 106 (2013).
Martyn, Blick, Brindle, and et al. “Great Bedwyn/Shalbourne (Wiltshire).” The Rural Settlement of Roman Britain: an online resource, 2015. https://doi.org/10.5284/1030449.
